item.title: Designing Data-Intensive Applications Notes
item.description: atomic In the context of concurrent operations: describing an operation that appears to take effect at a single point in time, so another concurrent process can never encounter the operation in a â€œhalf-finishedâ€ state. See also isolation. In the context of transactions: grouping together a set of writes that must either all be committed or all be rolled back, even if faults occur. REST REST is not a protocol, but rather a design philosophy that builds upon the principles of HTTP.
